intro: Astragalus microcymbus, commonly known as the small-calyx milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia, including parts of Mongolia and China. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of the genus Astragalus. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
